purpose: To present the tactical levers supporting leading usage strategies.
title: The leading usage strategies are supported by an array of tactical levers

text_rules.emphasis_rule: Title is bold and larger than table text

tables.description: Table outlining various tactical levers and their descriptions along with remarks/best practices.

cells: Timely and relevant communication via multiple channels is critical to maintain top-of-mind awareness
A well-defined social media strategy will reduce marketing costs, increase speed-to-market, and reach the optimal target audience

Effective promotions can change customer behavior, e.g.,
- Credit line increases
- Spend & get
- Pricing promos
Promotions can be more effective used in combination rather than used alone for specific segments
KPIs are tracked to measure the different stages including spend stimulation, balance build and stickiness
Key usage KPIs combine to inform the general health of the portfolio
Use data analytics to design targeting offers based on individual preferences and usage patterns
Analyze transaction data to understand usage patterns, then design targeted promotions to stimulate desired usage patterns
Behavioral segmentation helps inform issuers about their card portfolios and impacts on their overall performance

There are different effective segmentation approaches, including:
- High level schema utilizing spend, payment behaviors and tenure
- Detailed decision trees to define and describe segments
- Card usage segments to distinguish accounts by wallet position

The process of testing the impact of a program with a select customer pool to compare the performance of test customers to a well-matched control group across a pre-determined list of performance metrics

Issuers should be able to anticipate expected program impact, e.g.,
- What is the impact across key performance metrics?
- What is the target customer group, i.e., the group of customers that responds most positively to the tested concept?
- How can elements be modified for maximum impact?
Propensity models can be developed to address specific needs across the usage phase of the credit lifecycle and target treatments with exceptional accuracy
There are many types of propensity models including spend attrition, recurring payments, and luxury spend etc.
